metadata.name: Cell Based Toxicology LabProcess mode
metadata.description: Crate-o mode capturing toxicology assays with explicit Bioschemas LabProcess workflow links. RECOMMENDED WORKFLOW: (1) Add test chemicals via 'Chemical Information' group. (2) Add cell lines and create Sample entities via 'Biological Model Information'. (3) Create 4 LabProcess entities representing your workflow: Sample Preparation (seed cells) → Treatment (chemical exposure) → Endpoint Measurement (assay readout) → Data Analysis (curve fitting). (4) Link LabProcess entities in Dataset.processSequence. Each LabProcess should specify inputs/outputs (tracking Sample/File flow), executesProtocol (link to methods), and parameterValues (specific experimental conditions). Use the 41 parameter templates provided to quickly add common parameters!
metadata.author: J.M. Houweling
metadata.license: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

inputGroups.name: General & Structure
inputGroups.help: Core dataset metadata and how this crate is structured.

inputGroups.name: Chemical Information
inputGroups.help: Test substances associated with this assay.

inputGroups.name: Biological Model Information
inputGroups.help: Biological models and derived samples exposed to the chemical(s).

inputGroups.name: Workflow & Processes
inputGroups.help: Key exposure and measurement details to capture as LabProcess steps.

inputGroups.name: Analysis and Statistics
inputGroups.help: Information about the data analysis methods and statistics, as well as the used software for data evaluation

Sample Preparation.name: Cell Density
Sample Preparation.description: Number of cells seeded per well

Sample Preparation.name: Passage Number
Sample Preparation.description: Passage number of the cell culture

Sample Preparation.name: Seeding Volume
Sample Preparation.description: Volume of cell suspension added per well

Sample Preparation.name: Pre-incubation Time
Sample Preparation.description: Time cells were incubated before treatment

Treatment.name: Substrate
Treatment.description: Primary substrate or assay reagent (e.g., T3, MTT)

Treatment.name: Test Chemical Concentration
Treatment.description: Concentration range or specific concentration of test chemical

Treatment.name: Vehicle
Treatment.description: Vehicle/solvent used and its final concentration

Treatment.name: Technical Replicates
Treatment.description: Number of technical replicates per condition

Treatment.name: Positive Control
Treatment.description: Identity and concentration of positive control

Treatment.name: Negative Control
Treatment.description: Identity of negative control (e.g., vehicle only)

Endpoint Measurement.name: Detection Method
Endpoint Measurement.description: Detection or readout method (e.g., Sandell-Kolthoff reaction, fluorescence)

Endpoint Measurement.name: Substrate
Endpoint Measurement.description: Substrate or reagent for detection (e.g., T3, MTT, resazurin)

Endpoint Measurement.name: Instrument Model
Endpoint Measurement.description: Model and manufacturer of detection instrument

Endpoint Measurement.name: Digestion Method
Endpoint Measurement.description: Method for sample digestion if applicable (e.g., UV-light, APS)

Data Analysis.name: Analysis Software
Data Analysis.description: Software used for data analysis (e.g., GraphPad Prism, R, Python)

Data Analysis.name: Regression Model
Data Analysis.description: Mathematical model used for curve fitting (e.g., first-order kinetic, four-parameter logistic)

Data Analysis.name: Effect Metric
Data Analysis.description: Primary effect metric calculated (e.g., BMC20, IC50, EC50)

Data Analysis.name: Benchmark Response Level
Data Analysis.description: Benchmark response level for BMC calculation

Data Analysis.name: Normalization Method
Data Analysis.description: Method for normalizing data (e.g., to vehicle control, to positive control)

Data Analysis.name: Normalization Controls
Data Analysis.description: Controls used for normalization (e.g., vehicle control as 100%, positive control as 0%)

Data Analysis.name: Statistical Test
Data Analysis.description: Statistical test applied (e.g., two-way ANOVA, Dunnett's test, t-test)

Data Analysis.name: Outlier Handling
Data Analysis.description: Method for identifying and handling outliers

inputs.name: additionalType
inputs.help: Root is always a Dataset; choose exactly one ISA role: Investigation, Study, or Assay. Use additional values only if also aligning to a domain profile.

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: Title of this toxicology dataset.

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: Narrative description of the assay, matching the BioStudies study description.

inputs.name: version
inputs.help: Version string for this dataset (RO-Crate) release.

inputs.name: dateModified
inputs.help: Last update timestamp for this dataset package.

inputs.name: datePublished
inputs.help: Release date for this dataset.

inputs.name: license
inputs.help: License or terms of reuse, ideally a URL.

inputs.name: identifier
inputs.help: Identifiers for this dataset (e.g. DOI, internal accession).

inputs.name: author
inputs.help: Authors associated with the dataset.

inputs.name: citation
inputs.help: Citations associated with this dataset (e.g. related publications). Enter a DOI.

inputs.name: funding
inputs.help: Funding.

inputs.name: isPartOf
inputs.help: Larger collections of datasets(study) that this dataset(assay) is part of.

inputs.name: hasPart
inputs.help: Folder or File that form part of this dataset.

inputs.name: processSequence
inputs.help: Ordered LabProcess references describing the assay workflow. Create LabProcess entities for key experimental steps (e.g., 'Cell Culture', 'Chemical Exposure', 'Endpoint Measurement', 'Data Analysis'). Each LabProcess should reference a LabProtocol (the method), specify inputs/outputs (Samples, ChemicalSubstances, Files), include parameterValues for this specific execution, and optionally link to bioassayType and measuresAopEvent for semantic enrichment. Link LabProcess instances here in chronological order to document your complete experimental workflow.

inputs.name: AdverseOutcomePathway

inputs.name: AopEvent
inputs.label: AOP event
inputs.help: Key events from the referenced AOP that are evidenced by this dataset.

inputs.name: chemicalInformation
inputs.help: Chemicals tested in this assay. Use the ChemicalSubstance lookup to find a compound by name, CAS number, or other identifier, then add entries for each test chemical, control, or vehicle. You can later select these as inputs in your LabProcess workflow steps.

inputs.name: biologicalModelInformation
inputs.help: Cell line or cellular model used.

inputs.name: AopEvent

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: Cell line or biological model name. Use Cellosaurus lookup for catalogued lines (e.g., HepG2), or manually enter for distributed but non-catalogued lines (e.g., lab-specific stable transfectants from research institutions). For your specific experimental preparations, create Sample entities that link to this CellLine.

inputs.help: detection instument used in this bioassay

inputs.name: detection instrument manufacturer
inputs.help: Manufacturer of the detection instrument used in this bioassay.

inputs.name: measure entity
inputs.help: The role of a molecular entity of being the output of a biological reaction or process that is quantitated either directly (by the presence of a tag or probe) or indirectly in a coupled reaction.

inputs.name: endpoint
inputs.help: The endpoint is a quantitive or qualitative interpretable standardized representation of a perturbation (a change from a defined reference state of a closed model system) that is measured by the bioassay. An endpoint consists of a series of data points, one for each perturbing agent (screened entity) tested the assay.

inputs.name: license

inputs.name: conformsTo
inputs.help: Profile this assay adheres to (e.g., ISA-RO-Crate).

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: Human-readable label for this parameter (e.g., 'Cell Density', 'Exposure Duration', 'Temperature'). This is the display name users will see.

inputs.name: propertyID
inputs.help: Machine-readable identifier for the property type. BEST PRACTICE: Use ontology URIs (e.g., 'https://w3id.org/tox/terms#cellDensity', 'http://schema.org/temperature') for FAIR compliance. Simple strings (e.g., 'cell_density') are also acceptable but less semantically rich.

inputs.name: category
inputs.help: Classification of this parameter for grouping and organization. Choose from: 'experimental_condition' (temp, time, pH), 'reagent' (chemicals, substrates), 'method' (techniques, procedures), 'instrument_setting' (wavelength, gain), 'study_design' (replicates, controls), 'sample_characteristic' (passage, confluency), 'software' (analysis tools), 'analysis_parameter' (statistics, thresholds), 'control' (positive/negative controls). This helps organize parameters in UI and enables filtering.

inputs.name: value
inputs.help: Value or reference for the parameter.

inputs.name: unitText
inputs.help: Human-readable unit.

inputs.name: valueReference
inputs.help: Reference object for this value (e.g. protocol, file).

inputs.name: annotationValue
inputs.help: Preferred label of the ontology term.

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: Optional description or scope notes.

inputs.name: termSource
inputs.help: Identifier or URI of the vocabulary/ontology.

inputs.name: termAccession
inputs.help: Accession or curie for the term.

inputs.name: termCode
inputs.help: Machine readable short code.

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: Sample name. This entity represents the actual biological material used in your experiment (e.g., 'HepG2 cells, passage 12, cultured in DMEM'). Samples flow through your LabProcess workflow as inputs and outputs. Use 'sourceMaterial' to link this sample to its origin (CellLine, ChemicalSubstance, or another Sample).

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: Summary of the sample characteristics.

inputs.name: characteristics
inputs.help: Biological/chemical characteristics of the sample

inputs.name: factors
inputs.help: Experimental factors applied to this sample.

inputs.name: isControl
inputs.help: Indicates whether the sample is being used as a normal control, may be in combination with another sample.

inputs.name: sourceMaterial
inputs.help: Source material or reference from which this sample is derived. For chemical samples, link to the ChemicalSubstance entity. For biological samples, link to another Sample or CellLine.

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: Material name.

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: Material description or role.

inputs.name: characteristics
inputs.help: Material characteristics or attributes.

inputs.name: derivesFrom
inputs.help: Parent material/sample.

inputs.name: isControl
inputs.help: Indicates whether the material is used as a control.

inputs.name: sourceMaterial
inputs.help: Source reference for this material.

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: Select a common workflow step name or enter a custom label. Recommended 4-step workflow: (1) Sample Preparation: culture/seed cells; inputs=CellLine, outputs=Sample, parameterValues=cell_density/passage_number/culture_medium. (2) Treatment: chemical exposure; inputs=Sample+ChemicalSubstance, outputs=Sample, parameterValues=exposure_duration/concentration/vehicle/replicates. (3) Endpoint Measurement: measure readout; inputs=Sample, outputs=File, parameterValues=substrate/measurement_type/instrument, IMPORTANT: add bioassayType and measuresAopEvent. (4) Data Analysis: process data; inputs=File, outputs=File, parameterValues=normalization_method/software.

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: Process summary and goal.

inputs.name: performer
inputs.help: Person or organization performing the process.

inputs.name: inputs
inputs.help: Samples or materials entering the process.

inputs.name: executesProtocol
inputs.help: Protocol executed by this process.

inputs.name: outputs
inputs.help: Samples, intermediate materials, or data generated.

inputs.name: bioassayType
inputs.help: Type of bioassay being performed in this process (e.g., cell viability assay, gene expression assay).

inputs.name: measuresAopEvent
inputs.help: AOP key event(s) that this process measures or contributes evidence for (e.g., oxidative stress, DNA damage, cell proliferation).

inputs.name: parameterValues
inputs.help: Process-specific parameter values.

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: Process step name.

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: Process summary and goal.

inputs.name: performer
inputs.help: Person or organization performing the process.

inputs.name: inputs

inputs.name: executesProtocol
inputs.help: Protocol executed by this process.

inputs.name: outputs
inputs.help: Materials or data generated.

inputs.name: parameterValues
inputs.help: Process-specific parameter values.

inputs.name: startTime
inputs.help: Process start time.

inputs.name: endTime
inputs.help: Process end time.

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: Sample preparation workflow step name (e.g., 'Cell seeding, day 0').

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: Briefly describe the cell prep or seeding operation.

inputs.name: performer
inputs.help: Person or lab executing the preparation.

inputs.name: inputs
inputs.help: Starting materials (CellLine records or precursor Samples).

inputs.name: executesProtocol
inputs.help: Seeding or culture protocol applied.

inputs.name: outputs
inputs.help: Prepared Samples (e.g., cells seeded in 96-well plate).

inputs.name: cell_density
inputs.help: ParameterValue recording cell density at seeding.

inputs.name: passage_number
inputs.help: ParameterValue for passage number of the culture.

inputs.name: seeding_volume
inputs.help: ParameterValue capturing the volume used for seeding.

inputs.name: culture_medium
inputs.help: ParameterValue describing the culture medium / supplements.

inputs.name: incubation_time
inputs.help: ParameterValue detailing incubation time prior to treatment.

inputs.name: plate_format
inputs.help: ParameterValue indicating plate size/format (e.g., 96-well).

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: Treatment/exposure step name.

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: Describe exposure setup and intent.

inputs.name: performer
inputs.help: Person or organization executing the exposure.

inputs.name: inputs
inputs.help: Samples (cells) and ChemicalSubstances entering the process.

inputs.name: executesProtocol
inputs.help: Exposure protocol followed for dosing.

inputs.name: outputs

inputs.name: exposure_duration
inputs.help: ParameterValue describing exposure duration.

inputs.name: concentration
inputs.help: ParameterValue recording nominal/measured concentrations.

inputs.name: temperature
inputs.help: ParameterValue for exposure temperature.

inputs.name: vehicle
inputs.help: ParameterValue describing the vehicle/solvent and its concentration.

inputs.name: biological_replicates
inputs.help: ParameterValue indicating count/definition of biological replicates.

inputs.name: technical_replicates
inputs.help: ParameterValue capturing technical replicate setup.

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: Endpoint measurement step name.

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: What readout is captured and why.

inputs.name: performer
inputs.help: Person/organization running the assay readout.

inputs.name: inputs
inputs.help: Treated Samples provided to the readout.

inputs.name: outputs
inputs.help: Files or Samples generated (e.g., raw data files).

inputs.name: executesProtocol
inputs.help: Measurement protocol executed.

inputs.name: bioassayType
inputs.help: BioAssay Ontology classification (e.g., uptake assay, viability assay).

inputs.name: measuresAopEvent
inputs.help: AOP key events measured or supported by this readout.

inputs.name: parameterValues
inputs.help: ParameterValues capturing instrument settings or assay conditions for this measurement.

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: Data analysis step name (e.g., 'Normalization and statistics').

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: Summary of the analysis workflow, scripts, or software.

inputs.name: performer
inputs.help: Analyst or tool executing the processing.

inputs.name: inputs
inputs.help: Raw data files or upstream result files entering analysis.

inputs.name: outputs
inputs.help: Processed data files, figures, or tables produced.

inputs.name: executesProtocol
inputs.help: Analysis protocol, pipeline, or software workflow executed.

inputs.help: ParameterValue describing normalization / data processing approach.

inputs.name: software

inputs.name: name
